page.title: 04ECOLOGY OF PRESTON CAPES
page.content: Due to its remoteness the area immediately around Preston Capes has an abundance of wildlife. The woods and thickets hold both roe and muntjac deer, also fox, badger, grey squirrel, weasel, stoat and a large rabbit population. Apart from the usual woodland and garden birds there are the three British Woodpecker, tawny and little owl, a pair of kestrels, sparrow hawk and in recent summers, a hobby. Within the area there are twelve ponds with the usual pondlife including the Great-crested newt.
